io.netty.channel

Class AbstractChannel.AbstractUnsafe

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.AbstractChannel.AbstractUnsafe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Channel.Unsafe
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAioChannel.DefaultAioUnsafe, AbstractNioChannel.AbstractNioUnsafe
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractChannel

    protected abstract class AbstractChannel.AbstractUnsafe
extends Object
implements Channel.Unsafe
    Unsafe implementation which sub-classes must extend and use.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractChannel.AbstractUnsafe() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginRead()
      Schedules a read operation that fills the inbound buffer of the first ChannelInboundHandler in the ChannelPipeline.
      void bind(SocketAddress localAddress, ChannelPromise promise)
      Bind the SocketAddress to the Channel of the ChannelPromise and notify it once its done.
      void close(ChannelPromise promise)
      Close the Channel of the ChannelPromise and notify the ChannelPromise once the operation was complete.
      void closeForcibly()
      Closes the Channel immediately without firing any events.
      protected void closeIfClosed() 
      void deregister(ChannelPromise promise)
      Deregister the Channel of the ChannelPromise from EventLoop and notify the ChannelPromise once the operation was complete.
      void disconnect(ChannelPromise promise)
      Disconnect the Channel of the ChannelFuture and notify the ChannelPromise once the operation was complete.
      protected boolean ensureOpen(ChannelPromise promise) 
      void flush(ChannelPromise promise)
      Flush out all data that was buffered in the buffer of the Channel.Unsafe.headContext() and was not flushed out yet.
      void flushNow()
      Flush out all data now.
      ChannelHandlerContext headContext()
      Return the internal ChannelHandlerContext that is placed before all user handlers.
      SocketAddress localAddress()
      Return the SocketAddress to which is bound local or null if none.
      void register(EventLoop eventLoop, ChannelPromise promise)
      Register the Channel of the ChannelPromise with the EventLoop and notify the ChannelFuture once the registration was complete.
      SocketAddress remoteAddress()
      Return the SocketAddress to which is bound remote or null if none is bound yet.
      void sendFile(FileRegion region, ChannelPromise promise)
      Send a FileRegion to the remote peer and notify the ChannelPromise once it completes or an error was detected.
      ChannelPromise voidFuture()
      Return a VoidChannelPromise.

    • Method Detail

      • sendFile

        public final void sendFile(FileRegion region,
            ChannelPromise promise)
        Description copied from interface: Channel.Unsafe
        Send a FileRegion to the remote peer and notify the ChannelPromise once it completes or an error was detected. Once the FileRegion was transfered or an error was thrown it will automaticly call ReferenceCounted.release().
        Specified by:
        sendFile in interface Channel.Unsafe

      • closeForcibly

        public final void closeForcibly()
        Description copied from interface: Channel.Unsafe
        Closes the Channel immediately without firing any events. Probably only useful when registration attempt failed.
        Specified by:
        closeForcibly in interface Channel.Unsafe

      • beginRead

        public void beginRead()
        Description copied from interface: Channel.Unsafe
        Schedules a read operation that fills the inbound buffer of the first ChannelInboundHandler in the ChannelPipeline. If there's already a pending read operation, this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        beginRead in interface Channel.Unsafe

      • flush

        public void flush(ChannelPromise promise)
        Description copied from interface: Channel.Unsafe
        Flush out all data that was buffered in the buffer of the Channel.Unsafe.headContext() and was not flushed out yet. After that is done the ChannelFuture will get notified
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Channel.Unsafe
